questions.payment: Which payment methods do you accept?
questions.payment_text: We accept all major credit cards, including Visa, Mastercard, and American Express.
questions.replacement: When should I replace my tires?
questions.replacement_text: Legally the minimum tread depth is 1.6mm, but for safety we recommend replacement at 3mm (summer) or 4mm (winter). Also check for cracks, bulges, or aging (older than 6-10 years).
questions.seasonal: What is the difference between summer, winter, and all-season tires?
questions.seasonal_text:
‚Ä¢ Summer tires: Optimal above 7¬∞C, harder compound for grip on dry/wet roads.
‚Ä¢ Winter tires: Essential below 7¬∞C, deeper tread and softer rubber for grip on snow/ice.
‚Ä¢ All-season tires: A compromise for moderate climates, suitable year-round but performance is less than specialized tires in extremes.
questions.balancing_alignment: What is the difference between balancing and alignment?
questions.balancing_alignment_text:
‚Ä¢ Balancing: Ensures the wheel rolls smoothly without vibration at speed (done with every tire change).
‚Ä¢ Alignment: Ensures wheels are straight relative to the car for driving straight and even tire wear (needed if pulling to one side or after suspension repair).
questions.tpms: What is TPMS and can you service it?
questions.tpms_text: TPMS (Tire Pressure Monitoring System) monitors your tire pressure. We can install, reset, and replace TPMS sensors when batteries are depleted.
questions.repair: Can you repair a flat tire?
questions.repair_text: Yes, often. If the puncture is in the tread and not too large, we use a professional plug/patch. Sidewall damage often cannot be safely repaired.
questions.recycling: What happens to my old tires?
questions.recycling_text: We dispose of your old tires in an environmentally friendly way through certified recycling partners (Recytyre), so the rubber can be reused.
